subject: [Full Throttle Empire] Some plugins have failed to update
preview: G'day! Plugins failed to update on your site at https://www.fullthrottleempireaustralia.com.   Please check your site now. It’s possible that everything is working. If there are updates available, y

action.text: Manuel Lito Manceli marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
G'day! Plugins failed to update on your site at https://www.fullthrottleempireaustralia.com.


Please check your site now. It’s possible that everything is working. If there are updates available, you should update.


The following plugins failed to update. If there was a fatal error in the update, the previously installed version has been restored.
- WooCommerce Buy One Get One Free (from version 5.3.2 to 5.4.0) : https://woocommerce.com/products/buy-one-get-one-free/




These plugins are now up to date:
- Elementor (from version 3.24.5 to 3.24.7) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/elementor/
- Google for WooCommerce (from version 2.8.5 to 2.8.6) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/google-listings-and-ads/
- Jetpack (from version 13.9 to 13.9.1) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/jetpack/
- OptinMonster (from version 2.16.5 to 2.16.7) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/optinmonster/
- Pixel Manager for WooCommerce (from version 1.44.1 to 1.44.2) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/woocommerce-google-adwords-conversion-tracking-tag/
- Site Kit by Google (from version 1.136.0 to 1.138.0) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/google-site-kit/
- WooCommerce Direct Checkout (from version 3.3.9 to 3.4.0) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/woocommerce-direct-checkout/
- WooCommerce PayPal Payments (from version 2.9.2 to 2.9.3) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/woocommerce-paypal-payments/
- WooCommerce Stripe Gateway (from version 8.7.0 to 8.8.0) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/woocommerce-gateway-stripe/
- Yoast SEO (from version 23.5 to 23.7) : https://wordpress.org/plugins/wordpress-seo/


To manage plugins on your site, visit the Plugins page: https://www.fullthrottleempireaustralia.com/wp-admin/plugins.php


If you experience any issues or need support, the volunteers in the WordPress.org support forums may be able to help.
https://wordpress.org/support/forums/

The WordPress Team
